name: Guinness World Records 2000 Quiz | General | 10 Questions

questions.text: In which U.S. state would you find the biggest North American casino?
questions.explanation:
Connecticut.

	The Foxwoods Resort has a gaming area of 192,670 square feet.

questions.text: Which world record was once owned by Walter Cavanagh?
options: Youngest person to walk across Europe
Oldest man with a drivers license
questions.explanation:
Most credit cards.

	He once had a total of 1,397 credit card with a total credit limit of $1.65 million.

questions.text: What was Allison Hargreaves the first woman to do?
questions.correct: Reach the summit of Mt. Everest alone and without extra oxygen
options: First to jump from the Empire State Building
First woman on Mir Space Station
First woman to sail solo around the world
questions.explanation:
Reach the summit of Mt. Everest alone and without extra oxygen

	She reached the summit of Mt. Everest in 1994.

questions.text: Which world record was held by Christian Taillefer of France?
questions.explanation:
Fastest cyclist on a glacier.

	He went 132 MPH on a Peugeot Cycle at the Speed Ski Slope in Vars, France.

questions.text: In the year 2000, what was the world's tallest structure?
questions.explanation:
North Dakota.

	The tallest structure was located near Fargo, North Dakota. It was a television transmitting tower that stood 2,064 feet tall.

questions.text: What world record was once held by John Evans of the United Kingdom?
questions.correct: Heaviest car balanced on a head
questions.explanation:
Heaviest car balanced on a head.

	He balanced a 350 pound Chevy on his head for 12 seconds. All I wonder is how do you learn that you are capable of doing this?

questions.text: What record did Johnny Dell Foley and Keith Thomas own?
options: Most times hit with a pie
Participants in the longest boxing match
questions.explanation:
Longest egg throw.

	Johnny Dell Foley threw an egg 323 feet 2 inches to his partner Keith Thomas who caught it without the egg breaking.

options: Flight around the world on the Concorde
Highest average income for a country
questions.explanation:
Longest taxi ride.

	Jeremy Leving, Mark Aylett and Carlos Arrese took a taxi from London, England to Capetown, South Africa and back. I guess they've never heard of flying.
